summary: The Arnolfini Portrait, painted in 1434 by Jan van Eyck, is a famous oil painting in the National Gallery, London. It shows the Italian merchant Giovanni Arnolfini and his wife in their home in Bruges. The painting is special because of its realistic details, beautiful colors, and clever use of perspective. Van Eyck used new techniques with oil paints to make the picture look very lifelike. This painting is considered a major artwork in Western history.
title: Arnolfini Portrait
